  • Field Details

    • keyStr

      public static final String keyStr
      This is the secret key used to sign the JWT token. It should be a long random string. In a real scenario, it should either be injected from the environment like the following line.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • TokenController

      public TokenController()

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      @PostMapping("") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) public String generateToken(@RequestBody LoginRequest loginRequest) throws Exception
      This method is used to create a JWT token and return it to the client. The password is hashed before being compared with the stored password, because the stored password is hashed in the database.
      Parameters:
      loginRequest - contains the username and password of the user trying to login to the system from the http request body
      Returns:
      the JWT token as a string
      Throws:
      Exception - if the username or password is wrong or if the JWT token cannot be created for some reason

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(Long userId)
      This method is used to create a JWT token, it takes the user id as a parameter and returns the JWT token as a string.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id of the user
      Returns:
      the JWT token as a string

    • getTokenSubject

      public static String getTokenSubject(String token)
      gets the subject of the token (the user id) and returns it as a string
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token
      Returns:
      the user id as a string if the token is valid
